chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brianna L. Hoople was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).
  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on April 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter to Judge re: bond reduction
Letter to Judge re: bond modification

11:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brianna L. Hoople appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Breanna Magallones for Brianna L. Hoople appeared in court. Calling 22CF53, 21CM203, 22CM23 & 22CM42. 22CF53 set for a preliminary hearing. State calls Oneida County Sheriffs Deputy Michael Barron/sworn/direct by Pfeifer/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Pfeifer/cross by Magallones/witness is excused. State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Deputy Alyssa Knabenbauer/sworn/direct by Pfeifer/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Pfeifer requests a separate arraignment date. Magallones filed motion to modify bond. Pfeifer/Magallones statement to bond. Court will set $1000 signature bond in 21CM203. Bonds continue in other cases. adj. 11:36 PM
Arraignment scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
